Name: I Corp
Description:
I Corps covers the North Vietnamese campaign to take the northern part of South Vietnam in March 1975.

The map is 16 by 28 hexes and covers the area from Dong Ha to Quang Tri.

Combat is voluntary. Movement is constrained by a large number of special rules. There are other special rules for artillery, fuel supply, naval support, and civilian dislocation.

An alternate scenario has the South Vietnamese 1st Parachutist Division not being withdrawn to Saigon.

Name: II Corp
Description:
II Corp [sic] covers the North Vietnamese offensive in the Central Highlands in March 1975.

The map is 16 by 28 hexes and covers an area rougjly from Nha Trang to Bong Son. It has some color, unlikely many Perry Moore productions of this period. There are 11 two-day turns.

All units are battalions except for a few ARVN Regional Force companies. The ARVN are hampered by morale rules and supply rules. There are special rules for a possible intervention by B-52s and for Thieu's withdrawal order.

Name: Apocalypse
Description:
Apocalypse covers the final battle for Saigon from April 1st-May 12th 1975.

The map is made from five small sheets of different sizes which join to form a roughly 37 by 41-hex area from Tay Ninh to Bung Tau. The NVA units are regiments except for tank battalions; all ARVN units are battalions.

Name: Amethyst
Description:
The kingdom is under attack by ferocious monsters. Unfortunately, the the armory is empty. The King will reward a Merchant Miner that can arm the great heroes  of the kingdom. You will need to Mine and Build items so that heroes can slay monsters to keep the kingdom safe once again.

Amethyst takes place over a series of turns. Each a turn a player will have 5 actions to choose from. They may mine for gems, build an item using those gems, slay a monster using those items, trade gems, or recruit citizens to help you with any of that. Once all the monsters have been slain, the game ends and all points are added up. Highest score wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Rules for Wargames: 18th Century Warfare
Description:
18th Century Warfare

Miniature wargame rules for conflicts in the 18th century using miniatures between 6mm and 25mm in scale.

Name: Germany's Tank Attack: 1918
Description:
This game takes place during the Second Battle of Villers-Bretonneux in late April 1918. This was notable for being the first tank-vs.-tank battle ever fought.

The game map covers the central portion of this operation at a scale of 180 yards per hex. Units are infantry platoons and individual tanks. Turns are 90 minutes.

A contemporary reviewer noted some issues with the game, e.g. the fact that there is only one night turn after the 12 day turns so it is impossible to reproduce the actual events (in which Australian troops counterattacked at night).

Name: Triumphant Standards: Political Warfare Between the Wars for Through The Mud and The Blood
Description:
Triumphant Standards supplement covering the 1938 Very British Civil War, the Irish War of Independence and the Freikorps in the German Civil War!

Free expansion available per request after purchase of Through The Mud and The Blood

Name: ワードン (Wordon)
Description:
The game ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ³ (Wordon) consists of a pad of papers showing the Japanese hiragana alphabet in a grid of letters overlaid on a map of the ocean, with a coast and a few islands.

The winner of the game will be the first to sink the opponent's ships.  At the beginning of the game, the players agree on a topic, and secretly choose three words, of different lengths, corresponding to their three ships.

On their turn, a player can either try to guess the word for one of the opponent's ships or guess a letter in their grid.  If the player guesses a letter, the opponent responds either that it was a hit, a splash, or a miss.

A ship sinks when either the word is guessed or each of the letters used to spell the word has been "hit".

Name: Fighter Command
Description:
Fighter Command is a detailed game clearly about the Battle of Britain, although the map depicts an imaginary island nation being attacked by an imaginary continental nation.

The rules cover speed, altitude, fuel, radar, sighting, differences among airfields, reconnaissance missions, and much more. The level of detail allows players to experiment with different tactical choices, e.g. the "Big Wing."

Turns are 10 minutes each and must be plotted well in advance.

In addition to the rules and the 11"x16" map the game includes 132 uncut counters.

Name: From Empire to Revolution: An Eastern Front Supplement for Through The Mud & The Blood
Description:
From Empire to Revolution is a supplement by Chris Stoesen introducing us to the Russian and Austro-Hungarian Armies on the Eastern Front.  Chris has charted a path through the minefield of the Eastern Front to provide details of force organisation and tactics for the war, as well as sixteen varied scenarios covering the period from 1914 to the revolutions of 1917 which removed Russia from the conflict.

The scenarios are as follows:

     In Search of a Drink, September 1914
     Bridge Over the Wislonka, October 1914
     Spilling Royal Blood, October 1914
     Clear the Trench, October 1914
     A Hunting Expedition, Spring 1915
     Noblesse Oblige, March 1915
     Yashka, Easter 1915
     A Terrible Harvest, August 1915
     A Scouting Party, Fall 1915
     Bagging a General, November 1915
     Kept in the Dark, November 1915
     Frontkämpfer, April 1916
     Dead Mens Hill, August 1916
     Against All Orders, October 1916
     The Brides of Death, Spring 1917
     Ending with a Bang, July 1917


This PDF supplement is designed to be used with Through the Mud & the Blood rules.  
The scenarios range from between 10 to 100 or so figures a side.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tiwanacu
Description:
The players are architects who, over nine rounds, will compete to build the greatest temple that the god Inti has requested. Each player will be drafting tiles, in order to score the most points at the end of the game.

Will you build the legendary temple Tiwanacu and be rewarded by the gods?

The game is played in 9 rounds. Every round, each player will receive  tiles that he must place in his temple, to try to score the most points. At the end of the 9th round, players will add up all their points and the player with the most points is the winner.

Each game two random God cards will be picked that will change some of the basic rules or add ways to score points at the end of the game. 


Round structure
1.    Place tiles in each turn order position as indicated in the current round marker. The tiles that are where the row selector is, will be the active tiles and are available to purchase this round. The other tiles will be available next round. 
2.    Starting with the player in first place and following player order, each player takes his turn.
3.    All the tiles available in the active row that were not picked, are returned to the box. 
4.    Move the row selector to the next group of tiles (if it was on top, move it to the bottom. And vice versa) 
5.    Move the round marker to the next space.
After 9 rounds, the game ends.Player turns
On their turn, each player in player order will the following: 
1.    The player moves his piece from their current order position to an empty position in the player order track. 
2.    He pays (or receives) the amount indicated on the position. If he doesn’t have enough money to pay, the player will get a loan token and 10 coins. 
3.    Takes the 3 tiles from that position and place them next to their temple board.
4.    The player must put the 3 tiles he has next to his player board. The rules for placement are as follows:
a.    He can place in any position in his grid. 
b.    He can choose the order of placing the tiles, but the 3 tiles must be placed this turn.
c.    If he wishes, he can pay 1 coin to place it on top of a previously placed tile. 
d.    The grid can have empty spaces.
e.    After placing a tile, it cannot be moved for the rest of game.
Note that some God cards and rounds may change the number of tiles you need to place and change some of the tile placement rules. God cards rules always take precedence over the rules above. 
5.    After he has placed all his tiles, the next player in player order does the same.
End of game
After the last player has finished his turn in the 9th round, the game will end. The players will add up their scores and the player with the most points is the winner.

Scoring
At the end of the game, players will score points depending on the layout of their board and the god objectives. Each type of tile score in the following way.
Color Tiles (Red, Blue. Yellow and Green)
Red tiles scoring in two ways:

     1 point per color tile, regardless of figure. If a player has more than one colored area, they only score for their biggest one.
     Points according to the number of figures and multipliers. If there are Multiplier tiles next to a colored tile (that have the 2x in the same coloredbackground) they will multiply the number of figures on the tile by 2 for each multiplier tile surrounding it. 


Monolith Tiles

     Monolith tiles score depending on how many different ones you have in a set. There are  6 different monoliths designs, an a set of 1/2/3/4/5/6 will score 1/3/7/12/18/25 respectively. 
     If a player has more than 1 set of monoliths, each one of them will be scored separately. For example, if a player has 2 sets of different monoliths, one with 3 tiles and the other with 2, he will get 10 points (7 for the first one and 3 for the second one). 


Extra scoring
After all types of tiles have been scored, each player will receive additional points for the following criteria:

     1 point per Gold coin still in their possession. 
     1 point per tile in their biggest zone (can coloured tile or a monolith tile).
     10 points if they have at least one tile of each of the five colours (red, yellow, green, blue) and a Monolith. If a player is missing of the types, he doesn’t receive any points. 
     Points awarded by completing God cards, if applicable)


Penalties
Each player will receive negative points for the following criteria

     -15 points per Loan token.


Final score
Each player will add up their points and the one with most points at the end of the game, will be the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Piecepack Matchsticks
Description:
The piecepack matchsticks are a set of pieces designed to open up new gaming possibilities for the piecepack game system. Originally inspired by the little colored sticks used for route-building in games like Settlers of Catan, the piecepack matchsticks provide a wide variety of options beyond (but including) network and route building.

The matchsticks come in 4 suits and 6 lengths that correspond to the suits and values of the piecepack. Each stick's length represents a relationship between the grid squares on the back of a piecepack tile- from "null" cubes that represent a single point in space to "5" sticks that represent the full diagonal length of a tile.

The matchsticks can be used for many different mechanics including: 
-Connections and pathways
-Walls and barriers for area enclosure and maze building
-Spatial mechanics that go “outside the box” of the square grids that define many piecepack games
-Resource tokens that match up with piecepack suits and values
-Additional movement tokens for games that require more pieces of one type than a single piecepack can provide
-And as many other uses as a designer can imagine.

Like the piecepack, the piecepack matchsticks are a public domain game system, which means that anyone is free to make and even sell a set without paying royalties.

Name: Brutal: Close Up and Personal Combat – A Tribal Supplement
Description:
TRIBAL moves onto turf wars and gang fights in BRUTAL – Close Up & Personal Combat.

BRUTAL examines the politically charged conflicts between Gangs of New York’s Five Points; 
Mob-violence as a political tool by agitators in Late Republican Rome; 
the carefully managed clashes between neighbourhood gangs in Renaissance Italian cities; 
Turf-wars between gangs in the Industrialising cities of Great Britain, Paris and Australia; 
post-apocalyptic dustups in the Wastelands; 
and even two-fisted action from masked superhero/vigilantes!

There are also NEW rules for:

     SOLO-play;
     bringing along guns to a knifefight;
     interventions from the police/citizen-militia;
     and units of black powder musketry.


You will need a copy of TRIBAL – the Skirmish Combat rules to use this book.

—description from the publisher

Name: Satchel: A Journey Unknown
Description:
Satchel: A Journey Unknown is a solo adventure game. You are an adventurer sent on a quest to find a lost artifact in order to save the world. Scattered throughout the land are magical altars which hold clues to the items location, but they are well guarded. Someone or something doesn't want you finding the source of all this madness. Find the artifact before time runs out, or all is lost.

Every turn you will be revealing a part of the map, which is different with each game. The game features multi-use cards, which you may trade for items and gold or imbue into weapons to fend off dangerous creatures. With the coins you earn, you can upgrade your abilities making your survival more likely. An AI system will be moving around and spawning new creatures, so choose your fights wisely.

—description from the designer

Name: Papeon Paper Wargame
Description:
Papeon is a papercraft based tabletop wargame. The game mechanics rely mainly on the actual physical ability of the paper figure itself. That means, if a player wants to attack an enemy unit from a distance, a player must craft a paper figure that can do exactly just that!

Essentially each player takes turns controlling several paper figures of various types and battles them against another player’s paper figures.

With Papeon, players will have a great time not only while playing but also when crafting and customizing the paper figures.

Craft, Customise, and Charge!

—description from the designer

Name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Across the Wastes – The Rescue: Part 1
Description:
A desperate mission sends the rangers deep into the trackless desert north of Alladore. Somewhere in that wasteland is a hidden entrance to the Shadow Deep, an entrance that could prove the only chance for a daring rescue…

This book is the first of three that together make up a single mission called ‘The Rescue’. It includes 4 new scenarios designed for rangers of level 10 and above, as well as a pair of unique companions, and a host of fearsome new monsters. The book also includes a section on Advanced Herbalism that greatly increases the number of herbs that are available to rangers and gives new rules for using them and searching for them during missions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kuchenny poker
Description:
Twelve dishes belonging to four cuisines of the world are waiting to be prepared, and you are one of the competing chefs.

Whoever first completes the ingredients needed to make a selected dish scoops the money, so do not get sucked! You buy and choose ingredients so that you earn as much as possible on the dishes in which you use them. You collect them in the pantry, but if you invest in the fridge, you will protect some of them from corruption and ... Magda's just anger, because wasting food costs dearly.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: The Crew: Flight to the ISS
Description:
This expansion adds 3 new missions; the base game is unchanged.
It was published in the German and English versions of Spielbox 2/2020.
Was also available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

First mission:
Distribute the playing cards and, in turn starting with the commander, announce how many tricks the crew member on your left will take. The mission is accomplished when all tricks have been played and all announcements were correct.

Second mission:
Draw 4 tasks. All 4 tasks must be fulfilled in 4 consecutive tricks.

Third Mission:
Place the blue 1, 2, 3 and 4 task cards in the middle of the table instead of drawing 4 random cards from the task deck.

Name: Circle the Wagons: Wildest West and More Lone Cowboy
Description:
This is a promo set of 4 additional cards for Circle the Wagons:


     Circle the Wagons: Lone Cowboy Rides Again: 3 Lone Cowboy scenarios for solo play (previously released as part of the Board Game of the Month Club).
     a Wildest West scoring condition (which was a twitter joke that made its way to a digital promo card).

Name: Fractured System
Description:
A free to download and play game created by Chris Winterburn & 'The Unicorn Collective' Facebook Group Community.

Fractured System is an easy to play, action pawn and area control game set in a single solar system. 2 - 4 players can compete for control by moving their ships, attacking opponents, exploring, laying control tokens and researching ship upgrades.

A game takes between 30 and 60 minutes to play and players aged 7+ can enjoy it.

—description from the designer

Name: Combo Color: Print & Play Demo
Description:
The game of conquest by colors! —description from the publisher.

Combo Color is a strategic family game. Explore and expand your territory by coloring the boxes on the board in turn, while also collecting and combining items to win the most points. When the whole board is colored in, it’s time to count your points! —description from the publisher.

This print & play version contains two 1-sided boards.

Published during the COVID-19 2019-2020 Pandemic. The publisher posted:
"In these difficult times, we see families needing joy and entertainment more than ever; turning towards board games and party games to bring their loved ones together. We at Asmodee have created free print & play versions of some of our most popular family games, for anyone to print, use, and enjoy from home."
Families: Series: Free PnP during 2019-2020 COVID-19 Pandemic (Asmodee)

Name: Mój pierwszy Alias
Description:
A word game with popular Disney characters. Develops vocabulary in preschool children. Big, nice and solidly made cards with heroes from favorite cartoons. Passwords are items or characters known to every child.
Everyone is playing at the same time - you don't have to wait for your turn.
The game is intended for 3-6 players aged 3+.
Contents: Board, 192 cards, 8 pawns + plastic stands, rotating arrow with stand and hourglass.

The game is about guessing the passwords on the cards. The player takes a card from the face-down pile and turns the hourglass that measures the time. Then explains the card word descriptively. If the correct answer is given before the hourglass sand spills over, then both the explanatory player and the teak who guessed the password move their pieces on the board. The first player at the finish wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Concept: Print & Play
Description:
"You don’t need to talk to communicate!" —description from the publisher.

Make people guess hundreds of objects, characters, and titles by combining universal icons! —description from the publisher.

This print and play version has 30 cards showing pre-selected clues.  Players try to guess the answer and then check their guesses against the provided answers.

Published during the COVID-19 2019-2020 Pandemic. The publisher posted:
"In these difficult times, we see families needing joy and entertainment more than ever; turning towards board games and party games to bring their loved ones together. We at Asmodee have created free print & play versions of some of our most popular family games, for anyone to print, use, and enjoy from home."
Families: Series: Free PnP during 2019-2020 COVID-19 Pandemic (Asmodee)

Name: DinoGenics: Breaking News Promo Cards
Description:
Originally available through the Dice Tower 2020 Kickstarter.

A set of 3 breaking news cards for Dinogenics.

Shuffle into the deck of breaking news cards and proceed as normal.

Name: Western Legends: The Man In Black – Multiplayer Variant Promo Cards
Description:
A set of 6 Man In Black and one rules reference cards for Western Legends. Available through the Dice Tower 2020 Kickstarter and as an add-on during the Western Legends: Blood Money Kickstarter campaign.

Expands the Man in Black to be used with 3+ players.

Card # P-03, P-04, P-05, P-06, P-07 & P-08

Name: Połowy Morskie
Description:
Simple game about fishing trawlers sailing trough the Baltic Sea. Players directs their vessels to catch as many fishes as they could reach thanks to dice thowing. Trawlers sails by straight lines. One six-sided dice shows exact number of fields which vessel have go. Fishes are collected only when boat stops on a field with one.

Nice trawler figures made of plastic and ugly fish pictures with various tonnage. No negative interaction. Mostly depends on luck but need a little thinking about move direction for planning next possible moves.

—user summary

Name: Alluvium
Description:
There is an unexplored land appearing at the end of the ice age. Players are the heads of five fantastical races setting out to cultivate this mysterious land. Though pioneering this land is a collaborative effort, the other races are mischievous and may be disturbing your progress while pretending to cooperate.

Alluvium is a flip-and-write game with a twist: after each round, the sheets are passed clockwise to the next player and the sheets will come back to the original player with multicolored shapes from each of the opponents' work.

Each turn, a card is flipped. Players then draw that shape in their color in an empty area on the sheet in front of them. By helping to make a larger contiguous area, they will earn cooperation points toward a bonus, but they will also be helping the owner of the sheet get a higher score. After drawing the shape, players pass their sheets to the player on their left and repeat.

Name: Ambush: Epic
Description:
“A brave warriors group enters the shadowy dungeon, with the intent to defeat the cruel evil forces inhabiting there. Dungeon darkness, battle stress and gloomy fluids emanating from its walls will push our  courageous heroes to their limits. The battle is not only against the evil forces, but also against each other, to obtain the greatest glory and the biggest loot.”

Ambush: Epic is a semi-cooperative board game for 1 to 4 players. Lead your hero to the creepy and darkest nook of the dungeon. Balance your competitive and cooperative skills, get stronger but don't forget to give a hand when it is needed. Don't let the evil forces win! Reap the glory by yourself or share it with your allies.

Be part of the epic crew, making the villagers write ballads about your feats. May the best strategy reap the glory!

Name: Curmudgeon
Description:
You’re a cantankerous crank,a surly grump, a crusty grouch, and an ill-tempered malcontent all in one body! This game rewards you for being the biggest Curmudgeon on the block because it’s pretty great.

Use word cards to invent and throw silly insults at opponents' life cards. Star retort battles with fill-in-the-blank and prompted cards. Match colors or symbols on those retort cards to keep the battle going. Last one to play a retort, wins that life card and scores points.

You create the funny, even if you're not. Unlike other party games that have other players judge you, anything you say goes. Where other games provide the funny and you just string it together, this game provides the prompts to let your creativity shine through. It's like a game of mad libs...with insults.

The biggest curmudgeon wins the game!

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Curmudgeon is a game of insults! Use your own creativity to build insults from keywords. Throw those insults on other players’ life cards, engage in retort battles, win the battles and earn points. After the final round, all players have died and the game ends. The person with the most points wins and dies the biggest Curmudgeon!

GAME CONTENTS:
89 – Life Cards (4 blank for customization)
94 – Insult Cards
96 – Retort Cards
38 – Curmudgeon Cards
1 – Rulebook
6 – Lame Cards
6 - Cheat sheet cards
1 - Last Breath card
1 – Player Indicator

-description from publisher

Name: Zombienation 2060
Description:
The era of zombies has begun, and they need you to fight all the opponents and manage to be the winner, assemble 4 teams and the best man wins, you will have hours of fun, entertainment and strategy. What are you waiting to take it?.

Zombienation 2060 is a strategic board game that takes place in a world destroyed by a rare zombie virus. Your objective is to take your clan to conquer the world and the last remaining humans.

You take control over one of the four faction of zombies. During your turn, you move your zombies through the map to explore territories to find items or human survivors to add to your army. If you enter a territory already occupied by zombies from a different faction, you have to fight those to gain control over the territory.
The game is played over several rounds until one of the faction kills the leader of one another faction or kills at least 6 special zombies. With 3-4 players, the game can also end by reaching the explosion level of the round track, where the faction with the most territories under control wins.

It's also possible to improve your gaming experience with a free app that provides some level of augmented reality and different missions for every player.

Name: Jr. Ranger Ruckus
Description: A Fast-Paced Frenzy to Finish First! This card game plays like "Spoons" or "Pig." Be the first to collect three similar cards,and then place your finger on your nose. Stay alert because you don't want to be last to touch your nose. There are fifteen fun categories filled with facts that all Jr. Rangers should know.

Name: 18th Century Wars of Absolutism: Basic Campaign Rules
Description:
The book contains an introduction into 18th Century Warfare including both land campaigns and naval campaigns. The land campaigns include information on troop types, weapons, formations and battlefield tactics. The Naval includes information on the ships armament, naval strategies and fighting tactics.

The unique system of Decision Games is explained, which with the use of Programmed Events and Chance Events form the basis of the campaign rules which are included.

In the campaign modules the commanders are given historical objectives and the forces that were available to them. This book provides the rules to re-fight the campaign modules with the methods for troop manoeuvres being dependent upon their commander’s ability, weather and plain luck. Forces march along defined routes, must maintain a line of supply and set down depots. They suffer from sickness and desertions but occasionally receive reinforcements. The rules also include a system of bidding which accurately portrays the skirmishing and manoeuvring prior to a battle or withdrawal.

Troop strengths are always recorded in terms of Army Points (APs) or Naval Points (NPs). This book gives an in depth justification of the balance between APs NPs and VPs (Victory points) based on extensive research. The system greatly simplifies campaign logistics.


     Strategic Map Manoeuvre.
     Commanders’ Personalities.
     Programmed Events.
     Rules for Off table encounters for pre-battle scouting and rearguard actions.
     Rules for post battle pursuits and rearguard actions.
     Points system for evaluating Campaign Results.
     A unique system for determining battles by dice rolls.
     A unique system for determining dice rolls by telephone.


—description from the publisher

Name: 18th Century Wars of Absolutism: Fortress & Siege Rules
Description:
The siege rules make use of the authors Decision Games system which enables a siege to be conducted in terms of Stages as outlined by the great French military engineer Sebastion de Vauban. The system uniquely and realistically enables the timing of the advancing stages of a siege to run sequentially with the land campaign and along the timetables set by Vauban and so make sense in the context of a campaign.

Within the campaign system, each fortress is classified as being either weak, medium, strong etc. and a Victory Points value (VPs) incorporated into the initial balance. Dependent upon the strength of the fortress it is allocated a garrison strength (APs) and a garrison morale value (GM) plus a proportionate amount of provisions (GPRs).

Similarly the besieger whose strength (APs) is dependent upon the situation in the campaign, monitors his own force’s morale (BM) which will vary as the siege progresses and with comparison with Vauban’s timetable. The presence and size of any siege train or the approach of a relieving force are also critical to success.

This siege system enables the besieger to choose from a variety of tactics which may vary at each stage. These include sapping, bombardment and stratagems.
The defender similarly has a number of tactics to hand including stratagems and even the occasional sortie which can lead to a table top encounter.
The progress of the siege is dependent upon a cross reference of each side’s tactical choices some of which result in either a Reaction Test by the Garrison or the Besieger. These can result in surrender, a lifting of the siege or a continuation.


     Siege Decision Game Mechanics.
     Garrison’s Morale (GM) and Besieger’s Morale (GM).
     Garrison’s Provisions (GPs).
     Log’s for Sieges of Fortresses including Reaction Tests.
     Truth Tables.
     Diagram of a typical Vauban fortress and the siege stages.
     Honours of War (HOW).

Name: 18th Century Wars of Absolutism: Rules for Land Battles
Description:
The Land rules contain comprehensive standing orders for each troop type and battle orders assigned to each commander. Dependent upon the circumstances encountered during a game these force players and units to act historically. The casualty system uses HIT dice which translate immediately into battlefield and campaign casualties. After battle pursuits and rear guard actions necessary for a campaign are also included.

Units are organised as battlefield brigades rather than battalions or regiments to reflect the actual practice of the period and to fit in with the campaign system. This avoids the predicament which arises when army numbers are reduced by casualties and desertions and yet the number of battalions and regiments remains constant.

Commanders have an ability rating to reflect their own personality and that of the ability of their staff. Initiative each bound is dependent upon the ability of the commanders and dice rolls. Movement is alternative and dependent upon initiative. Charge Tests, Reaction Tests, shooting and melee is simultaneous.


     Formations.
     Organisation.
     Troops Points Values (APs).
     Order and Command.
     Reaction tests.
     Pre-Battle Manoeuvring.
     Table Top Terrain Maps.


—description from the publisher

Name: 18th Century Wars of Absolutism: Rules for Naval Battles
Description:
This book contains the Table Top Rules for Naval Battles.

The rules are suitable for both fleet actions and also small one on one encounters.

It includes an introduction to 18th century naval actions and tactics.

The battles are fought on hexagons with fleets manoeuvred with a system using specially designed order cards which players are invited to photocopy for their own use. Speed and manoeuvrability being dependent upon size of the ship, wind direction and the number of sails in use.

Damage is inflicted with the use of HIT dice. The HIT dice and associated Tactical Factors reflect range, size of gun and the size and protection of the enemy target ship. These are recorded by crossing out boxes on the ships log.

The ships are divided into Ships Of the Line (SOL) and Repeater ships consisting of Frigates, Sloops and Brigs. The Ships of the Line are further categorized by the number of guns that they contained. 90 gun, 80 gun, 74 gun and 64 gun. The simple game mechanism includes alternative moves in which orders are secretly chosen in advance and apply to the whole fleet and reflect the difficulty of handling multiple ships simultaneously as was the responsibility of 18th Century Admirals.

The simplicity of the rules enables fleet actions of ten or more ships per side to be completed in a single two to three hour wargaming evening with the pre action manoeuvring being a vital and enjoyable feature.


     Order Cards – Ships of the Line.
     Order Cards – Repeater Ships.
     Order Cards – Ships of the Convoy.
     Table Top Battle Logs for Fleet Actions.
     Table Top Battle Logs for Small Actions.
     Rules Synopsis.
     Players Reference Sheet.


—description from the publisher

Name: 18th Century Wars of Absolutism: Introductory Campaign – Mollwitz
Description:
This campaign is set in Silesia part of modern day Poland in the winter of 1741 and at the beginning of the second year of the conflict popularly known as the First Silesian War which later expanded into the wider conflict known as the War of the Austrian Succession. It attempts to re-enact the attempt by the Austrian army commanded by Marshal Niepperg to march to the relief of the blockaded fortresses of Neisse and Brieg and to simultaneously cut the Prussian occupying army’s lines of supply. Had the Austrians succeeded, King Frederick II (The Great) of Prussia would in all probability have been forced to surrender because his position in Silesia would have been untenable.

Frederick was taken by surprise and with many of his troops being dispersed into winter cantonments, it was a race against time to concentrate his forces before being attacked by the Austrians. Early on at the battle of Mollwitz it went badly for Frederick who fled the field only to discover that his army had gained a victory during his absence.

The campaign module does not aim to slavishly recreate the attempted relief of Silesia to the last historical detail. Nor does it attempt to fight the whole war or even every engagement across central Europe during 1741. Finally of course, it does not aim to re-fight the battle of Mollwitz on replicated terrain and with the historically accredited troops there. Instead it provides players with the information and mechanics to re-fight the Mollwitz campaign closely based on historically accurate forces, commanders and strategic considerations.

Its aim is to provide an interesting (and challenging) backdrop or context for table top battles.

This was a very short campaign being all over in less than 2 weeks. There are no sieges, naval actions or reinforcements involved. Consequently, it serves as an excellent introduction to the campaign system.

Contains:

     Historical Background.
     Campaign Map.
     Commanders.
     Initial Army Strengths and Fortresses.
     Progremmed Events.
     Chance Events.
     Army Lists.


—description from the publisher
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession

Name: 18th Century Wars of Absolutism: Land Campaigns I – Nish, Cuneo & Zondorf
Description:
This Book contains 3 standalone land campaign modules.

The Nish Campaign, 1737. Austrians v Ottoman Turks.
This campaign is set in Serbia in the late summer of 1737 during the Austro-Russian-Turkish War of 1736-39. It attempts to re-create the invasion of Ottoman Serbia by a Habsburg Imperial army led by Marshal Count Friedrich von Seckendorf and its opposition by the Ottoman Grand Vizier Al Haji Mohammed who commanded the Ottoman Army on behalf of his master the Sultan.

The campaign ended in a disastrous failure for the Austrians following their defeats at the battle of Valjevo and the recapture of Nish by the Ottomans.

The campaign includes at least one siege against a medium fortress (Nish), the probability of two other sieges and unusually the probability of some fortresses being besieged, captured and then re-besieged and recaptured by the relieving forces.

Special features of this campaign include the fact that the invading army decimated by sickness and in particular malaria, eventually becomes the prey. They are pursued and virtually destroyed by an aggressive relief force led by the Grand Vizier and defeated at the battle of Valjevo.

It also pits a poorly trained and equipped European army against a basically irregular Asian army with a high proportion of cavalry.

The Cuneo Campaign, 1744. French and Spanish v Austrians and Sardinians.
This campaign is set in north-western Italy in the summer of 1744 and is part of the wider conflict popularly known as the War of the Austrian Succession 1741-45. It attempts to re-create the Franco-Spanish (sometimes referred to as ‘Gallispan’) invasion of Piedmont, led by Prince Louis de’Conti which was opposed by Charles Emmanuel the King of Sardinia (Piedmont) with an Austro-Sardinian army who fought to protect his kingdom. Although victorious at the battle of Madonna dell’Olmo, the campaign ended with the Gallispans being forced to withdraw from Piedmont after torrential rain destroyed their siege works at Cuneo.

The campaign includes a potential siege or storming of a Weak Fortress, and a number of potential sieges against Weak and Medium Fortresses including the historical objectives of Demonte and Cuneo.

The Gallispan lines of supply across the Alps is an important and special feature of this campaign. The French objective was to capture an important fortress to be used as a base for the campaign planned for the following year. Another feature is the fortifications known as the Barricades built by Charles Emanuel to prevent the passage of enemy troops through the Stura Valley. The maneuvering and audacity of the Gallispan attack which resulted in the capturing of the fortifications was hailed as the feat of arms in Europe at the time.

The Zorndorf Campaign, 1758. Russians v Prussians.
This campaign is set on Prussia’s eastern borders with Poland in the summer of 1758 and is part of the wider conflict popularly known as the Seven Years War 1756-63.
It attempts to re-create the invasion into Prussia by a Russian army led by General Villim Fermor which was opposed by King Frederick II who personally commanded his own Prussian Army. The campaign ended after the bloody draw at Zorndorf with the Russians withdrawing from Prussia and Pomerania.

The campaign includes a potential siege or storming of a Basic Fortress, and a number of potential sieges against Weak Fortresses including the historical objective at Custrin/Kustrin (modern-day Kostrzyn).

Special features of this campaign include the fact that it has one army the Prussians, actively rushing to force a battle and destroy the enemy. A definite Napoleonic strategy and a far cry from the usual 18th C. maneuvers to capture fortresses or other possessions.

Each module contains its own:-
• Historical Background.
• An account of the historical campaign.
• Campaign Map.
• Programmed Events Table.
• Chance Events Tables.
• Army Lists.
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession

Name: 18th Century Wars of Absolutism: The Caribbean Naval Campaign
Description:
The naval campaign The Caribbean uses the unique Decision Games system and is based on the campaigns of 1781 and 1782 between the French Admiral Comte Francois de Grasse and the British Admirals Sir George Rodney, Sir Samuel Hood, Sir Francis S. Drake and Thomas Graves during the American War of Independence.

It includes three naval Decision Games.

Martinique re-enacts the arrival in the Caribbean of de’Grasse with the French fleet and the attempted interception of them by Sir Samuel Hood and his British fleet.

The Windward Islands re-enacts the attempts by de’Grasse to capture either Tobago or St Lucia whilst again Sir Samuel Hood attempts to prevent this.

The Big Prize is based on a conglomeration of the 1781 and 1782 campaigns where in 1781 de’Grasse had the option to either assist the Americans or to attempt to gain further possessions from the British in the Caribbean whilst 1782 saw the engagement between Sir George Rodney and de’Grasse at The Saints off Dominica.

Each of these Decision Games will produce a naval action which may be a major fleet action or a minor skirmish scenario such as Small Convoy, Pirates or Trapped. Table Top scenario maps are supplied for all possible outcomes.

A concise but well researched history of the occupation of the Caribbean Islands is included to give a thorough strategic and diplomatic back ground and to put the American War Of Independence into perspective from the British and French point of view.


     History Naval Campaigning in the Caribbean Islands
     Table Top Battle Logs for Fleet Actions.
     Table Top Battle Logs for Small Actions.
     Campaign Log British.
     Campaign Log French.
     Programmed Events.
     Chance Events.
     Campaign Map – The Caribbean.
     Three Naval Decision Games.
     Table Top Scenario Maps.
     Reference Sheets for Scenario Small Actions
     History of Naval Battles of the 18th Century.


—description from the publisher

Name: Spider-Man: Goblin Grab! Card Game
Description:
Villains threaten the city. Led by the notorious Green Goblin, they will surely crush all that is good and right. Spider-man has his work cut out for him-and it will take all his Spidey-speed to grab the Green Goblin(and all the cards) first!

Based on the popular game Slap Jack, this fast-paced card game will keep the Spidey-action flowing battle after battle.

52 card deck includes an instruction card and 3 BONUS VILLAIN CARDS!

How to play:

The goal is to win the Green Goblin and all the cards, by being first to slap each villain card as it is played to the center.

Deal cards one at a time face down, to each player until all the cards have been dealt. The hands do not have to come out even. Without looking at any of the cards, each player squares up their hand into a neat pile in front of them.

Beginning on the dealer’s left, each player lifts one card at a time from their pile and places it face up in the center of the table.
When the card played to the center is a villain card, the first player to slap their hand down on the villain takes it, as well as all the cards beneath it. The player winning these cards turns them face down, places them under their pile of cards, and shuffles them to form a new, larger pile.

When more than one player slaps at a villain, the one whose hand is directly on top of the jack wins the pile. If a player slaps at any card in the center that is not a villain, they must give one card, face down, to the player of that card. When a player has no more cards left, they remain in the game until the next villain is turned. The player may slap at the villain in an effort to get a new pile. If the player fails to win that next pile, they are out of the game.

Name: Monopoly: Canary Islands Edition
Description:
Discover the Canary Islands, the beautiful Lucky Islands.

Visit La Palma and El Hierro,  National park of Garajonay, Tenerife and Gran Canaria and much more... culture heritage sites, national parks as well as gastronomy, festivals and history.

Contents: 1 game board, 8 pawns, 28 Property cards of title cards, 16 community of luck, box of 16 cards, 1 pack of Monopoly money, 32 houses, 12 hotels, 2 dice, 1 dice Quick, rules.

Name: Acronymity: Player's Choice Edition Expansion
Description: The Player's Choice Edition expansion adds 476 new question cards to the Acronymity board game, in which you answer questions about acronyms and abbreviations. The publisher compiled this new set of questions from suggestions sent in by customers who'd bought the original game.

Name: Acronymity: Genius Edition Expansion
Description: The Genius Edition expansion adds 476 new question cards to the Acronymity board game, in which you answer questions about acronyms and abbreviations. The publisher compiled this new set of questions from "the most interesting and challenging acronyms on the planet".

Name: The Megs
Description:
The Megs is a cyberpunk two player competitive card game for players aged 14+ where cards positioning is central and, with highly-thematic effects, will generate  brain-burning situations.

In The Megs, you will use colourful characters called Operators to wage corporate war against an enemy Megacorporation. Positioning your Operators and activating their skills, you will try to complete extremely risky missions like assassinating a high-ranking enemy Operative or smearing high-visibility opponents in the infamy of a sex scandal but, most of all, you will deploy your best and slyest hackers to steal precious data from your opponent!

Played in three rounds called Operations or “Ops” over the course of 30 to 45 minutes, the game is playable on a 13 per 18 inches (33/45 cm) table and meant to offer the depth and challenge of bigger games with the option of reducing it to a shirt pocket-friendly size.

The mechanics aim at generating puzzle-like situations, bluff, double-guessing, and mind-bending domino-effect while introducing edgy characters and tense situations that will immerse the players into our special breed of the Noir Sci-fi genre that is cyberpunk.

Including high-tech assassins, vicious cyber-tox, mad salary-men, ruthless gangs of enhanced Yakuzas, mysterious shamans of the virtual world, terrorists from high-tech death cults and lethally sexy Black Widows, The Megs is made into a dark and daring world thanks to the outstanding art of genius illustrator Ania Kryczkowska (Gloom of Kilforth, Paradise Lost).

—description from the publisher

Name: Drogi do Niepodległości
Description:
The plot of the strategic board game Drogi do NiepodlegÅ‚oÅ›ci ("Roads to Independence") includes the most important historical events from 1795-1918 and shows the heroes of these events.

The main goal of the game is the implementation of one of the five political missions of an independent country. Players strive for their actions to shape the country as close as possible to the objectives of the mission. During the game, they play the part of family members living under the partitions. There are different routes for players. In several stages, they themselves decide what events they take part in, look for allies, use the help of heroes. The game is fought in three partitions and in exile. The family can get involved in political, military and socioeconomic activities.

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Rokugan at War
Description:
In the chaotic times ahead, with war on the tip of everyone’s tongue, the Great Clans of Rokugan will have to take stock of their resources. It’s time to raise armies, take to the court, and fight for your land. The Emerald Empire is at war, and nothing will ever be the same.

Jump into the fray with Rokugan at War, the first pack of the Dominion cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game!

Rokugan at War features 60-new cards to augment your favorite decks (3 copies each of 18 different cards and 1 copy each of 6 different cards) and introduces new mechanics that place an emphasis on a player’s provinces. Whether this means starting the game with a province faceup with the new Eminent keyword or overfilling a province with the powerful new Rally ability!

—description from the publisher
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Spreading Shadows
Description:
There is a darkness spreading through Rokugan. War is on the tip of everyone’s tongue and chaos has come to the Imperial Capital. Meanwhile, the Crab Clan fights valiantly to defend the Emerald Empire from the shadows spreading to the south. With Rokugan as unstable as ever, can the samurai of Rokugan stop the spreading darkness?

Defend Rokugan with Spreading Shadows, the second dynasty pack in the Dominion cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game!

Spreading Shadows continues to emphasize the themes of the Dominion cycle, introducing new eminent provinces, cards featuring the rally keyword, and a focus on powerful dynasty events.

—description from the publisher
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – In Pursuit of Truth
Description:
The Emerald Empire is gripped by turmoil. The Scorpion have seized the capital and Bayushi Shoju sits upon the throne as regent. While evil forces make their moves in the south and within the realm, the clans scrabble for power, abandoning the honorable virtues of BushidÅ. Which clans can survive the coming storm, and will Rokugan endure with its noble soul intact?

Navigate the chaos with In Pursuit of Truth, the third Dynasty Pack in the Dominion cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game!

As part of the Dominion cycle, In Pursuit of Truth adds unique new mechanics to challenge players’ understanding of the game—most especially with your provinces. The provinces under your control have been changed forever by the introduction of events in your dynasty deck, along with two new keywords: eminent and rally. Whether you’re venturing into enemy territory or defending your own people from invasion, you’ll find the game’s provinces placed in the spotlight.

—description from the publisher
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – As Honor Demands
Description:
In every part of the Emerald Empire, noble samurai are pushed closer to destruction by the rapidly changing fortunes of the Great Clans. Though the natural order has been disturbed, there are still clans and samurai who choose to hold fast to their ideals — but will those ideals ultimately lead them safely through the storm or condemn them to devastation?

As with the other dynasty packs of the "Dominion" cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game, As Honor Demands puts the focus squarely on your provinces, with the new eminent and rally keywords and an assortment of dynasty events that are played from your provinces. Beyond these themes shared across the entire cycle, this pack in particular offers a host of ways for players to increase their honor, unlocking new paths to victory for the Great Clans.

—description from the publisher
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Suomen Hauskin Huutokauppapeli
Description:
Suomen Hauskin Huutokauppapeli takes the players to the world of auctioning all around Finland with Aki, Heli and Markku! Are you skilled enough to recognize the treasures among the junk and do you dare to offer enough?

In this game the players purchase items that are auctioned in Hirvaskangas and obviously try to make the most profit. The weirdest items can be the most lucrative, but the famous copper pot might tip the scales!

Suomen Hauskin Huutokauppapeli offers fun and excitement for the whole family up until the last strike of the gavel!

—description from the publisher

Name: L.O.L. Surprise!: Ruckus Card Game
Description:
This is a simplified reskin of Ruckus.  Players collect cards with pictures of L.O.L. dolls by stealing from other players to form sets.  There are 72 cards (6 cards for each of 12 characters).

The endgame rules differ slightly from traditional Ruckus.  The rules specify scoring 77 points as the victory condition, regardless of the number of players.  Instead of shouting "OUT!" as in traditional Ruckus, players shout "RUCKUS!"

The game comes with an L.O.L. toy accessory (purse, sunglasses, bracelet, etc.) that is not used in the game.

Name: Twilight of Divine Right: By the Sword Divided – English Civil War Scenarios
Description:
By the Sword Divided is a scenario booklet for Twilight of Divine Right. 
It contains 10 scenarios from the English Civil Wars.

It features the following scenarios:

     Edgehill, 1642
     Lansdown Hil, 1643
     1st Newbury, 1643
     Cropredy Bridge, 1644
     Marston Moor, 1644
     2nd Newbury, 1644
     Naseby, 1645
     Knocknanoss, Ireland, 1647
     Winwick Pass (Preston), 1648
     Dunbar, 1650

Name: Twilight of Divine Right: Europe's Tragedy – Thirty Years War Scenarios
Description:
Europe's Tragedy offers battles from the Thirty Years War (1618-48).

It contains 12 scenarios:

     White Mountain, 1620
     Stadtlohn, 1623
     Lutter, 1626
     Breitenfeld, 1631
     Alte Veste, 1632
     Oldendorf, 1633
     Wittstock, 1636
     Tornavento, 1636
     Montijo, 1644
     Jankau, 1645
     2nd Nordlingen (Allerheim), 1645
     Lens, 1648

Name: ACP164: Albedo Combat Patrol – The Rule Book
Description:
ACP164 Albedo Combat Patrol provides the rules for playing skirmishes with miniatures in the science fiction setting of Steve Gallacci’s Albedo comics.
ACP164 can be played with as few as 4 figures per side up to company sized engagements with 50+ figures and supporting vehicles and flyers.

The following components are required to play ACP164. 

     The Activation Deck is used to control the sequence in which units activate during a turn. 
     The Action Deck is used to resolve fire, melee, and morale. Typically, each player has their own Action Deck. 
     Various Markers denote wounds, stun, out of ammunition and morale. 
     Unit Data Cards inform players of the attributes of the figures within the units they control as well as the weapons with which those units are equipped. 
     Model figures, terrain, etc. are used as playing pieces in this tabletop game. 
     Six-sided order dice are used as part of the Double Random ActivationTM mechanism to control the sequence in which units activate.

Name: 100 Things
Description:
In 100 Things, players quickly hunt for the correct six objects from an array of silhouettes. A clue-giver has the list, but using a rolled die, must constantly switch up their clue-giving between drawing, performing, and giving limited word clues. Players can play cooperatively to try and get all six items correct as fast as possible, or play competitively to record their guesses and compare for the highest score. Can you spot the right things in time?

100 Things is a free-to-play printable game designed during the COVID-19 crisis, and will remain available here and through the publisher's website forever, with continued support.

Name: Starline Industries
Description:
In Starline Industries, players take on the roles of galactic merchants seeking to make their mark on the universe (and impress their boss). Each turn players mark routes as they connect solar systems, gathering goods and credits along the way. Hoard goods for points and spend credits on valuable upgrades to your starship while dodging asteroids and pirates sent by other players. Each round three cards are drawn with special abilities based on the places you visit, allowing bending (and breaking!) of the rules in your favor. Sets of cards are used in coordination with special competitive goals, allowing for unique set-ups as you mix-and-match strategic scenarios.

Starline Industries is a free-to-play printable game designed during the COVID-19 crisis, and will remain available here and through the publisher's website forever, with continued support.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rush M.D.: ICU
Description:
You and your fellow doctors have been working tirelessly  treating patients all this time and you have helped your new Medical Center to acquire a good reputation and expand more!

But now, with the Medical Center opening an Intensive Care Unit and 4 new Examination Clinics, the pressure is even higher for the doctors to work together in order to save lives and treat everyone quickly but also efficiently. Can you live up to the challenge?

Rush M.D. – ICU is an expansion to the real-time, cooperative, worker placement game Rush M.D. It introduces the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) board, where you will be required to perform electrocardiograms (ECGs), defibrillation and administer pump infusion drugs quickly and efficiently to save lives of very ill patients! It also adds a new Medical Examinations board with 4 new thematic, dexterity mini-games to offer more choices for your game. In Rush M.D. you will also find brand new ICU patients as well as new Hospitalized patients, new objectives, and more!

Get ready to push your limits to save lives! Can you handle the pressure of ICU doctors?!

Name: Serengeti: A Race For Life – The Ranger
Description:
This is a mini-expansion of the base game of Serengeti: A Race For Life. It can be used in the standard version of the game opposing 2 players as well as the multiplayer version.

The Ranger replaces one of the Trail card in the players starting decks.

With the Ranger players now have the ability to track animals located under rocks, right from the start of the game and  without relying on an animal skill. They can also place it on an animal stack of their choice to protect it, potentially securing 2 points at the end of the game.

Name: Atlantis Rising: Medusa Unleashed
Description:
Medusa was once a beautiful mortal woman, but that beauty attracted the attention of the god Poseidon. The gods saw mortals as their playthings, and Poseidon was no different. He sought out the object of his lust and seduced her while she worshipped at the temple of Athena, and then he retreated into the sea. The goddess Athena discovered the blasphemous act which had occurred within her temple, and she punished Medusa with a terrible curse. Medusa’s mind was shattered, her hair turned to snakes, and all those who gazed upon her would be turned to stone.

The wrathful gods have now come to punish the Atlanteans, sinking their island forever. Knowing that the Atlanteans are clever, Athena unleashed the gorgon, Medusa, to turn the entire populace to stone and thwart any efforts to save Atlantis. As the waters rise, you and your fellow Atlanteans must work quickly to defeat the gorgon and save your people!

Medusa Unleashed is a new module for Atlantis Rising and can be used with any player count. The new expansion introduces Monsters, persistent misfortunes that continue to hinder your progress once activated. Each round, Medusa is drawn to a random tile on the island. Any Atlantean workers on this tile are immediately turned to stone! If there are no workers present, she instead targets the populace.Petrified volunteers fill the island tile and limit the number of available action spaces.

The Artisan comes to your aid as a new playable councilor. The Artisan can create mystical items to equip your workers, granting them exciting new powers. In a twist on the ancient myth, you can even construct and use a fabled mirror shield to break Medusa’s curse! With her curse broken, Medusa turns her rage towards the gods and joins your cause, unlocked as a councilor for future games!

—description from the publisher

Name: Bargain Quest: Sunk Costs
Description:
It's sink or swim in Sunk Costs, the latest expansion for Bargain Quest that brings the game to the Seven Seas!

This expansion introduces a variety of nautical heroes, monsters, and items for your shops, as well as the brand new "supply ships" game mode. Try not to go overboard!

—description from the publisher

Name: Evolutionary War: Miniature Gaming an Age in Which War Had Rules
Description:
Evolutionary War offers historical miniatures battles that open with sweeping Grand Tactical Manouevers, and then shift to an innovative command and initiative system where enemy units compete against their Morale Grade to complete the Tactical Evolutions expected of them during the course of an hour, rather than against whoever rolls the higher die. There are no markers or other battlefield clutter, the basing system lets the figures do the work! Assuming the units perform like clockwork as expected, Evolutionary War offers miniatures rules for an age in which war had rules. The challenge is in planning battles that takes advantage of those rules, the rewards come in historical miniatures battles that suit an age in which “taste” governed everything.

Period: Players can span the globe from Europe to the Americas or India ; as far back in time as the First Silesian War in 1740 and up to the early battles of the French Revolution before 1794.

Scale: The principal unit of the age was the infantry or cavalry regiment—militarily and socially—so the game is organized around this scale, with regiments as the basic playing pieces. This also allows players to campaign as the Chefs of particular regiments, without the huge expenditures necessary for battalion level games!

—description from the publisher
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession

Name: Crowbar Hotel
Description:
Everyone is innocent, Nobody is talking, and it is 500 feet to freedom… in the Crowbar Hotel! In this set-collection, hidden-movement, and push-your-luck one vs all game for 2-5 Players. Players take the role of either Mangy Prisoners or the Greedy Prison Guard in order to either craft, or disrupt a escape from jail before time runs out.

Lock yourself in and experience the desperation of 1960’s jailhouse life, as you search wisely while avoiding the guard to find the items to craft yourself escapes using items like homemade Grappling Hooks, Metal Shears, or Makeshift Shovels.

PRISONERS - The player(s) who take the role of prisoner have to escape from Crowbar Hotel by collecting sets of cards to craft items that will allow them to escape at certain marked points on the board

GUARD - The player playing the role of the guard must stop the prisoners from escaping. At the end of the 6th round if the prisoners have not escaped the needed amount. The guard is the victor.

BRIBES - Prisoner Players may spend cash or items of value to the guard in order to avoid detection or being caught for a shakedown or returned for rollcall

USE CONTRABAND TO ESCAPE - After Collecting sets of cards they complete a set to make items such as homemade Grappling Hooks, Metal Shears, or Makeshift Shovels to help escape and win the game!

---

This game uses hidden movement and set collection to create a both thrilling and enjoyable experience for everyone involved. 2 player games are very cat and mouse,  but when in larger groups (3-5) prisoner players must work together to both collect sets and avoid the ever growing faster prison guard.

—description from the designer

Name: Ranger Danger
Description:
Ranger Danger is a cooperative, 1-4 player board game where each player takes the role of a park ranger who has become separated from the rest whilst camping in a perilous forest: to win, they must find the central path again, reunite with the rest of the team, and make their way home. However, the forest is full of all manner of monsters and beasties who emerge once the sun sets, and the team must make their escape before the night fully draws in.

Each game of Ranger Danger proceeds over two distinct phases of play:

In Phase 1 (“Build the Forest”), players place tiles on the board to map out forest paths that will bring them back together and help them find the exit; placing monsters where required. In Phase 2 (“Escape!”), players move around the board, battling enemies and trying to survive long to make their way to the ‘Home’ tile.

If all four Rangers reach the central ‘Home’ tile before the Forest Tile stack has been fully depleted, they will successfully survive the forest and win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Rich Man Poor Man
Description: Mid 70's roll-and-move game where the object is to become the "Rich Man" by being the first player to move a pawn onto each of the yacht, the mansion, and the bank.

Name: Labyrinthspiel
Description:
The goal of the game is to escape the labyrinth of the minotaur. Movement is determined by a die.

—user summary

Name: Spanish Pyramid: Sixes & Sevens
Description:
Pirámide española (Spanish Pyramid) is a solitaire (patience, rèussite) card game challenges you to clear out a randomly created spread of cards by pairing them.

To play this game you will need a Spanish 48 card deck and a playing surface. Some skill in adding numbers is necessary but only up to 13. Instructions are also given for how to reduce a French/American deck of 52 cards down to the right size.

The game’s name derives from the pyramid shape of the starting spread. Six and 7 make 13.

Name: Battle for the First Panzer Army
Description:
Battle for the First Panzer Army covers the breakout of the eponymous army from its position in Ukraine in the spring of 1944.

The 21"x30" map (in four sections) has a scale of three miles per hex. There are over 200 counters; most units are regiments or divisions. There are fourteen turns of one day each (there is only one scenario).

The core systems are mostly standard. The Germans get an additional mechanized movement phase after combat. Combat itself is the most unusual aspect; the strength ratio determines not a column to roll on but a table, with the column in that table determined by troop quality and terrain. Troop quality has three levels and the highest-level units exert better zones of control than others.

Name: My Neighbor Totoro: Aruite Sagaso Totoro`s Dondoko Game
Description:
A diorama-style powerful game board!

Combines elements of standard memory game and traditional collect-and-win family games in a wonderful world of My Neighbor Totoro by Studio Ghibli.

In this game you will play as one of four small Totoros. 
On your turn you will roll the dice to move around big camphor tree and then:

-uncover as many matching memo cards as possible to get more acorns or get suprised upon uncovering disadvantage memo card

-encounter middle Totoro and move your Makkuro Kurosuke figure to the next level of the tree (this will also give you more acorns)

-perform special actions (only on specific fields): redraw or cards uncovering

Game finishes when any players Makkuro Kurosuke reaches the top of the camphor tree.

Goal:
To win the game collect the most acorns of all players until any player reaches top of the camphor tree!

Sounds simple, but surely satisfies with uniquely modified memo-game mechanics and surpising bonuses or disadvantages, which may cause sudden twist in overall outcome of the game.

Board game contains 10 Totoro related figurines, big camphor three, tokens and many cards with beautiful drawings from original movie.

Name: Ausonia: Masters of Shadow
Description:
In Masters of Shadows the base game is extended with Leader Cards, new Favour Cards and Mission Cards to seize powerful Artefacts.

Leader Cards:
If you are done playing with everyday nobility, slip into the roles of 6 leaders from great houses, which have special abilities and very distinct gameplay style.

Leader Starter Decks:
These leaders not only have unique abilities, but also 3-3 respective Favour Cards. The Gem Cards of the base games' starter decks just have to be shuffled with them and they are ready to play.

Artefact Cards:
Those longing for power have the opportunity to acquire the invaluable Artefacts of 6 guilds, providing further advantages during the game.

Mission Cards:
These Artifacts don't come easy, missions have to be accomplished to gather them!

9 House Leader Cards
27 Leader Starter Cards
40 Artefact Cards
10 Mission Cards
1 Rulebook

Name: Ausonia: Remnants of War
Description:
In Remnants of War the Base Game is enhanced by 3 new guilds, Defense, Infiltration and Event cards.

3 New Guilds:
3 new Guilds are joining the fray with their unique keywords and mechanics: knights ready for war, city guards protecting the streets, and the holy clergy.

Defense and Infiltration Cards:
With the Guards guild DEFENSE cards enter the game to protect against negative effects, and the Soldiers guild brings INFILTRATION cards to temporarily weaken your opponent's deck.

Event Cards:
If you feel you have figured out the game and all its mechanics, it's time to raise the stakes with Event Cards. You can never know what calamity or lucky incident will hit the conflicting rulers of Ausonia.

3 Additional Guilds (30 Cards)
6 Defense Cards
15 Infiltrate Cards
26 Event Cards
1 Rulebook

Name: Veilwraith: Absolution
Description:
Adds a further 15 Vignettes in your campaign, with all new Threats and Boss Foes to vex you in your quest to restore life and light to the world.

Comes with new Foes and Threats consisting of 138 new cards: 15 Vignettes, 69 Foes, and 54 Threats.

Name: The Quick & The Undead: Fast Play Zombie Rules
Description:
(Based upon Jane Austen – Zombie Killer Regency zombie rules by Jasmin Storey-Smith also by Partizan Press and available from Caliver Books)

The Quick and the Undead is a game for one or more players, based upon more zombie movies, TV shows, comics and stories than is healthy for one person to know about!

Designed for fighting the Undead, but easily adaptable for Human on Human survivalist games. 
Excellent for single scenario, or Campaign. 
The random generation of buildings, Loot and other features makes this ideal for SOLO play. 
Players are either human or Zombie… or both

Get it while you can. !!!!!!

It is the early C21st. Given the upheavals in Britain outlined in the background above, technologically, socially and musically it is about the Mid 1970’s. So too are the clothing fashions!

Cities and towns have been ransacked and then abandoned to the Undead. Survival lies in small villages in the British countryside. 
Remember that this isn’t a gun-happy US TV show.

This is a Campaign driven system, players start with a bunch of unarmed starving survivors that work their way up to hardened professional survivors… but don’t get too attached to anyone!. Of course one-off games are a must too.

Games should be scenario driven (find food, grab guns from a police station, empty fuel from cars on a road…. and then get the Hell out of Dunnie on the Wold) or a straight points based Shoot‘em Up (well, Bash‘em Up).

The possibilities are endless and you’ve seen enough films, etc. to sort it out.

—description from the publisher

Name: Russia's War
Description:
Russia's War is a strategic wargame of the Eastern Front of World War II in Europe.

It was available as a game kit requiring coloring and assembly of the 14"x15" map and mounting and cutting of the counters. There are 22 Axis and 62 Russian counters.

A contemporary review says it is very similar to the basic game of the designer's Sturm Nach Osten. However, it has a number of changes including retreat rules which give a variable degree of control over retreats depending on the precise combat results.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: My First Adventure: The Odyssey of the Phobos
Description:
Today, you’re setting off on an incredible adventure.
Today, you’re going to take your spaceship, The Phobos, to find your robot friend lost in the space.
Who do you want to be in this mission ?
Eclypse, the hothead pilot?
Toby, the inquisitive scientist?
or Gloub, the Moon mechanic?
Choose carefully and plunge into this rather unusual story, a story where each choice you make will change your adventure.

The Odyssey of the Phobos is the third book in the "My First Adventure" collection of stories in which you are the tiny hero. Choose your character and plunge in this rather unusual story, a story where each choice you make will change your adventure.

Name: ACP164: Sourcebook
Description:
Full colour, 64 page, softback A4 system agnostic sourcebook containing the background material for gaming in the Albedo Universe.
The source book can be used with the ACP164 Miniatures game, the Albedo RPGs or any other Sci-Fi RPG such as Traveller, Gamma World, Space Opera etc.

Includes:

     In the beginning..
     The First Lapine War
     The Enviroment
     Government & Society
     Life, Death Religon & Culture
     Technology
     The Military in Albedo
     Military Organisations
     Weapons & Equipment

Name: ACP164: The Almata Campaign
Description:
Full colour, 98 page, softback A4 system agnostic campaign guide
The source book can be used with the ACP164 Miniatures game, the Albedo RPGs or any other Sci-Fi RPG such as Traveller, Gamma World, Space Opera etc.

Includes:

     Campaign Background
     Notes on running campaign
     Campaign scenarios split into three 'story arcs'
     Force organisations
     Scenario maps & layouts

Name: Rolling Seas
Description:
Roll and Write exploration game for 1 to 6 players. Explore the islands and seas of the Alkundic Archipelago and tell tales of your voyages!

The seas of the Alkundic Archipelago have long been known for their treacherous storms, exhilarating currents, hazardous rocky outcrops, and even a mild infestation of sea monsters. You and a ragtag crew have set out to explore the islands and seas they occupy. Along the way you will have adventures, stop at ports to resupply, get a better ship, and tell the tale of your voyages. The more you tell your story the more reputation you’ll earn. Will your crew have the greatest tale to tell and earn the most reputation? Sail the Rolling Seas and find out!

Rolling Seas begins with everyone initializing their maps – drawing known adventures and choosing a Home Port. Each round has three quick phases that everyone participates in simultaneously: Adventures, Dice, and Actions. In the Adventure Phase you'll draw an Adventure card, which could indicate Smooth Sailing or add a new Adventure to your maps, like Sea Monsters, Storms, Pirates, and more! The Dice Phase consists of rolling two types of dice to determine the wind direction and exploration events. In the Action Phase each player can choose to Sail, Explore, or Visit a Port. As you Sail and Explore you’ll add to your Story. When you Visit a Port you’ll get to tell your Story to gain Reputation. The player with the most Reputation at the end of 25 rounds is the winner!

Name: 4 Data Brokers
Description:
Five centuries after Francis Bacon said that Scientia est potentia, we know information is power. The more information we have, the more power we get. Wholesale information, Big Data.

The XXI century has witnessed how some new brokers have arisen. Known as the Data Brokers, they are data processors which then distribute among companies, corporations and governments.  They know everything about us, even what we imagine.

The game 4 Data Brokers was born among the pages of a novel by Màrius Serra in which Oriol Comas is the main character.. Now, it goes from fiction to reality to let you experience the sense of power that only information can provide you.

During the game, players take cards form the player on their right, save two cards, vote to use special rules or take new scoring goals and finally resolve it trying to make combos or score regarding their goals.

After four rounds, the Data Broker with the most points wins.

Name: Sweet Holic
Description:
The sweets of the world-renowned dessert contest are sweeter than sweet. The theme of this contest is the sweet French dessert — macaron! You have to compete with macaron pâtissiers from all over the world and make the macarons more deliciously than anyone else. If you careless, the cookie (the outer parts of the macaron) can burn. To make the perfect macaron cookies and filling, you must have a perfect blend! Will you be able to defeat your competitors and win competitions to become the best pastry chef in the world?

Sweet Holic is a macaron-making board game for 2 to 4 players. At the start of the game, each player receives five hand cards, then discards a card of their choice in front of them. During a round, players have to choose to change their cards with the topmost card of one of the open discard piles or play macaron ingredients in their hand to finish a macaron. In order to finish a macaron, a player needs to collect a pair of the same kind of cookies and one filling card. Same-colored macarons score extra points.

If a burned cookie is included in the finished macaron, it gives -1 point.

After finishing a macaron, players draw back up to four cards. Add all the macaron scores to find the winner! Each player can receive extra points depending on the character card they received at the start of the game.

Name: GrillHolic
Description:
GrillHolic is a co-operative cooking board game in which players become chefs of famous restaurants and work together to complete steak dishes. Be sure to grill the beef parts and various fresh vegetables that are often used for real steaks so that they don't get burned by your trustworthy (?) team members. Complete the delicious cuisine to meet the demands of demanding guests, and preserve the reputation of a splendid restaurant!

In more detail, each player receives three cards in their hand, then rolls the dice to determine how much steak to prepare, then reveals the order cards accordingly. Players cooperatively play the fresh ingredients from their hand and cook to finish the order. The order will move on a time track, which represents the status of the steak from rare to well done. Serve the completed steak safely to the customer as they requested it. Burned steak as well as orders pushed out of the time track will be worth negative points

After a number of orders based on the player count, determine the team's final score.

Name: Tulip Holic
Description:
Tulip Holic is a light party auction card game that can be enjoyed by anyone of all ages. To prepare the game shuffle the cards depending on the number of players and deal out 4 cards to each player. The rest of the cards is the draw pile.

In a turn a card from the draw pile is revealed and all players must play a card face down and reveal it simultaneously. The player who played the highest card wins the revealed card and puts it in front of them together with the bidding card. Then every player places the bidding card in front of them and draws back up to 4 cards. 
Goal is to make a set of 6 same colored tulip cards in the value from 1 to 6.
After the deck is empty scoring happens. Whoever has the most points wins the game.

Name: Divisional Commander: 1st Carlist War – Organisation Tables
Description:
Divisional Commander: 1st Carlist War - Organisation Tables

Army lists providing stats to be used with Divisional Commander

Name: Granna Mushrooming in The Magic Forest
Description:
Ready for a fantastic adventure? mushrooming in the magic forest is a delightful game where you follow a path riddled with animal obstacles, to gather as many mushrooms as possible. The game is started by the person who last ate mushrooms. Players follow each other in a clockwise direction. One by one, they roll the dice and then advance as many squares as they have thrown. If they find a mushroom in the mezzanine where they got with their puppets, they put it in their basket.
The game ends when a player has walked the route and returned to or crossed the start field. Then the points have to be added up.

Name: Tipoucet
Description:
A cooperative game from the age of 6 where everyone plays against the ogre.
Take Tipoucet and his brothers through the forest to get back to the cottage and avoid the ogre that is prowling around. Free the captured children, take shortcuts to hide and return with the Treasures.
A game is played by 1 to 7 players and lasts about 20 minutes.

—description from the designer

Name: Bake & Sale
Description:
At last, your dream came true !!! You just started your own bakery ! During the course of the game, you will have to run your business for an entire week. Each single day you will have to get supplies, produce different types of bread and improve your baking techniques. But this is only the beginning of the story...
