At the end of the week, only the best bakers will have a chance to win the Baking Industry Awards.

Bake & Sale is a thinky, economic roll and write game for 1+ players of any age that was created as part of the Stuck at home contest.

—description from the designer

Name: 轟の迷宮 (Howling Labyrinth)
Description:
+•.*• Infinite Reflection-Puzzle •*.+*


A compact and hot puzzle-abstract game has arrived.
The purpose of this game is simple, to reflect your spells on the walls and hit hostile monster.

This game is for two people. Each has a priest and a monster on the board with square glids. They can act 3times consequently in a turn. Actions contain placing, sliding and rotating tiles, which have walls. In the end of turn, the actor’s priest spell out into 4 ways. They reflect on the wall. If none of them doesn’t hit enemy monster, the actor will be defeated immediately.

For detailed rules, please see "Manual_EN"s below.
—description from the publisher

Name: Clinic: Deluxe Edition – COVID-19 Pandemic
Description:
This is a small expansion that contains few more components to make Clinic Deluxe Edition a cooperative game:

     1 Propagation board
     99 COVID-19 tiles
     1 Syringe tile


—description from the publisher

Name: Walk the Rainbow
Description:
Walk the Rainbow is a Pad Pad Game. Pad Pad games are board games on small pads (1/3 A4). The board and the rules are on every sheet and everyone gets a sheet. The pad and a pencil is all that is needed. No big board to lay out, no fiddly pieces, easy to carry and simple rules, so the games can be played almost anywhere; on a ferry, train, waiting room, tent etc.

Story: The rain has stopped and the sun has come out, but where is the rainbow? If you follow the right paths from place to place in your own special, secret order, you will be the first to see it.

—description from the designer

Name: King's Trial
Description:
In King’s Trial, 2 to 5 brave adventurers will compete in the competition
of their lives - Get rid of the dragon and become the heir to the throne.

Travel through the randomly generated realm, completing various quests for the king
to gain his favor. Whether it be shooing away some evil sheep that are bothering
the farmers, organizing a magnificent party in the local amphitheater or 
gathering delicious pastries from a far-away village.

On your travels expect to meet all manner of characters who might try to block
your way. Help your fellow adventurers or hinder their progress, just don’t be 
surprised if they abandon you when you need them the most. 
Collect gems, help cards  and king’s favors to aid you in your journey, and only
once you are ready, you may face the terrifying dragon!...to bribe him of course. 
You’re not crazy enough to face him in direct combat, are you? The fastest 
adventurer to fulfil three quests and get rid of the Dragon will win the

KING’S TRIAL!

Name: Giants: The Action Figure Game of Colossal Combat
Description:
The Earth is under attack! Enormous monsters and massive machines have invaded the planet, destroying everything in their path.

But the Earth is not defenseless. It has harbored its own colossal creatures, myths come to life, and they are ready to defend their home.

The planet’s survival now depends on the claws and teeth of a few angry beasts. The giant monster rampage has begun!
Giants: The Action Figure Game of Colossal Combat is a turn-based miniatures game for two or more players set in a world besieged by monsters and machines of immense size.

—description from the publisher

Name: English Civil War: Gaming Scenarios
Description:
Scenarios for use with any ECW Rules System.

This book also contains 4 pages of ECW colour wargaming flags for 25mm, 15mm and 6mm scale miniatures

Contains the following scenarios:

     THE BATTLE OF NEWBURN - AUGUST 1640
     POWICK BRIDGE - 23 SEPTEMBER 1642
     THE BATTLE OF RIPPLE FIELD - 13 APRIL 1643
     THE BATTLE Of WHALLEY - 20th APRIL 1643
     THE BATTLE OF ROUNDWAY DOWN - 13th JULY 1643
     THE BATTLE OF CHERITON - 1644
     THE BATTLE OF ALFORD - 2ND JULY 1645
     THE BATTLE OF PHILIPAUGH - 1645
     THE FIGHT FOR DUMFRIES AND GALLOWAY - 1651
     THE BATTLE OF WORCESTER - 3RD SEPTEMBER 1651
     THE BATTLE FOR THE CAPITAL - 1659


Plus guidelines on English Civil War Uniforms & Equipment

—description from the publisher

Name: English Civil War: Gaming Scenarios – Vol 2
Description:
Scenarios for use with any ECW Rules System.

Contains the following scenarios:

     Against The Odds - Second Battle of Modbury, 21 February 1643
     "Prayers Come First" - The Battle of Beacon Hill, 23 April 1643
     "Come What May…" - The Battle of Stratton, 16 May 1643
     "Blood So Nobly Spent" - The Storming of Alton & Arundel, 13-14 December 1643
     "Rupert's Masterstroke" - The Relief of the Second Siege of Newark, 21 March 1644
     "Lord Wilmot's Wild Ride" - The Battle of Tipton Green, 12 June 1644
     "The Key That Lets Us Into Wales" - The Battle of Montgomery, 18 September 1644
     An Indecisive Action - The Battle of Fyvie, 28-29 October 1644
     "Prince Rupert's Last Victory" - The Battle of Ledbury, 22 April 1645
     "As God Would Have It" - The Battle of Auldearn, 9 May 1645
     "The Whole Kingdom Depends Upon This Bout" - The Battle of Denbigh Green, 1 November 1645
     "Sheer Folly -- Booth's Uprising" - The Battle of Winnington Bridge, 19 August 1659


—description from the publisher

Name: English Civil War: Gaming Scenarios – Vol 3
Description:
Scenarios for use with any ECW Rules System.

Contains the following scenarios:

     "Sent To Coventry! " - The Battle of Coventry, 19 August 1642
     "Beinge On Fire To Be At Them…" - The Battles of Southam & Dunsmore Heath, 24 & 25 August 1642
     "The Battell Fought Before Manchester" - The Siege of Manchester, 25 September - 1 October 1642
     "Let God Arise…" - The Storming of Leeds, 23 January 1643
     "So Obnoxious In Those Parts" - First Battle of Middlewich, 13 March 1643
     "A Fatal Blow" - The Battle of Selby, 11 Apr. 1644
     "A Certain Victory" - The Battle of Tippermuir, 1 September 1644
     "As Much As A Man Could Do" - The Battle of Wistanstow, 8 June 1645
     "The Most Gallant Peece of Service That Ever Was In England" - The Battle of Langport, 10 July 1645
     "A Very Sharpe Dispute" - The Battle of Willoughby Field, 5 July 1648
     "Papist Pound" - The Battle of the Severn, 25 March 1655


(The only English Civil War battle fought in the Colonies!)

—description from the publisher

Name: English Civil War: Gaming Scenarios – Vol 4
Description:
Scenarios for use with any ECW Rules System.

Contains the following scenarios:

     “To Give The Divill His Due!” - The Battle of Holmans’ Bridge – First Battle of Aylesbury,3 November 1642
     “Bradford’s Deliverance” - The Second Battle of Bradford, 18 December 1642
     “They Fell Upon Their Backs…” - The Battle of Highnam House, 24 March 1643
     “Disputed Very Strongly” - The Battle of Gainsborough, 28 July 1643
     “A Little Sconce…” - The Battle of Shieldfield, 3 February 1644
     “At Push of Pike and Dint of Sword…” - The Battle of Inverlochy, 2 Feburary 1645
     “Last Fight of the Northern Horse” - The Battle of Sherburn-in-Elmet, 15 October 1645
     “Let Your Manhood Be Seen By Your Push of Pike…” - The Battles of Ballaghkillgevill and Benburb, 5 June 1646 (2 scenarios in 1) 
     “Desperate and Hazardous - Sir John Owen’s Rising” The Battle of Y Dalar Hir, 5 June 1648
     “To Live or Die Together…” The Battle of St. Ouen’s Bay - Jersey Island, 22 October 1651
     “The Rising of Major-General John Lambert” The Last Battle of the English Civil Wars, 22 April 1660


—description from the publisher

Name: English Civil War: Campaign Scenarios – Vol 1: The 1643 Campaign for the South-West
Description:
For use with any ECW Rules System.

Contains the following campaigns:

     “To Do The Kingdome Good Service…” – The Battles of Glastonbury and Chewton Mendip, 12 June 1643
     “In the Mouthe of the Enimy…” – The Battle of Stoke Lane, 1 July 1643
     “A Very Hot Dispute” – The Battles of Monckton Farlegh and Claverton Down, 3 July 1643
     “The Boldest Thing I Ever Saw the Enemy Do…” – The Battle of Freezing Hill, 5 July 1643
     “A Very Pleasant Hill” – The Battle of Lansdown, 5 July 1643
     “We Might Fight No More in Holes” – The Actions at Chippenham, Rowde and Beckhampton, 8-10 July 1643
     “We Hope the Lord Will Keep Us” – The Siege of Devizes, 10-12 July 1643
     “Runaway Down!” – The Battle of Roundway Down, 13 July 1643


—description from the publisher

Name: Battalion: North Africa '40-'43
Description:
Battalion: North Africa '40-'43

Battalion is a world war two rule set detailing the North Africa Campaign from 1940 to 1943.

It is 1:1 miniature to real life counterpart representation.  Using 6mm scale miniatures and terrain.  
Players may wish to use 3 or 10mm miniatures also but other scales are not officially supported.

The rules are detailed yet fast.  Action is decisive, ranges are of engagement are long and movement distances are also relatively big.

What you see is generally what you get and the game has a lot less abstraction compared to other wargames.

The game features a quick play sheet, there are charts to look up sometimes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Emporous: Roll & Sail
Description:
A fast paced challenging Print and Play roll&write game about islands, riches, strategies and dangerous business. The game is about acquiring and spending your resources, to get as many points as fast as possible, by acquiring artisan works to fulfill contracts and acquire Masteries.

This game is a roll and write version of "Emporous: the boardgame" and implements most of it's set collection features adapted for a faster and more condensed experience, so as to fit the roll and write idea.

Name: Evermore Realms
Description:
Evermore Realms is a two-player card game featuring characters and elements of the living narrative that takes place in Evermore Park.

Form your own deck of 25 residents of Evermore, choose 3 to be your main party and go head to head with others to become the true Champion of Evermore!

Evermore Realms allows one to take the magic of Evermore Park home, and play a thematic game using the heroes, villains, and other elements that park guests will experience to defeat their opponent's party.

—description from the publisher

Name: ΠΕΤΡΟΠΗΓΗ
Description:
Monopoly style board game.

Buy oil-producing countries, build oil rigs and platforms and be the richest oil producer of the world.

Name: CoronaLine
Description:
CoronaLine is a 2-player paper-and-pencil game, which was made for everybody stranded at home during the corona virus crisis. All you need is a piece of paper, a pencil and two different markers.

CoronaLine is played on a grid of 31 dots. Every turn a player must draw a straight line from a dot they already occupy to an unoccupied dot. They can't cross multiple dots at once or their own lines. A player can cross 1 opponent's line to score a point, but then they must rest for at least 1 turn. The player who scores 3 points or is the last one to be able to make a legal move, wins the game.

The game is also great for playing over the internet since most chat rooms allow simple drawings over pictures.

—description from the designer

Name: Seeing Red: The Raid on Kronstadt Harbor, August 18, 1919
Description:
Seeing Red is a solitaire game on the British Royal Navy’s raid on the Kronstadt naval base during the Russian Revolution. Even before the armistice with Germany ended the fighting along the Western Front in WWI, British, French and US forces were deployed to attack Soviet controlled Russia to undermine and perhaps overthrow the Communists from power in Russia. One of the more daring Allied attacks occurred when a British flotilla of Coastal Motor Boats (CMB) was dispatched to raid the Soviet occupied naval base of Kronstadt. The raiders were supported by aircraft launched by the world’s first aircraft carrier, HMS Vindictive, making this one of the first combined air/sea attacks in military history.

Soviet warships based at Kronstadt safeguarded St. Petersburg (soon to be renamed Leningrad), and were severely contesting Allied warships in the Baltic. The harbor was considered one of the most heavily fortified ports in Europe, and many in the British Admiralty considered the raid a suicidal gamble. The active player takes on the role of the commanders of the British ships and aircraft. You must endeavor to overcome the Soviet defenses and night-time visibility to inflict as much damage as possible before being killed, captured or fleeing, and then escaping with those vessels and aircraft that survive. Can you do as well or better?

—description from the publisher
